column5: I just wanted to post our results from our trip to the Gullrock chain last week of July.Fishing was tough was on water from 5:00am to 9:00pm daily with only a small break for lunch. Our two biggest challenges was May Flies and heat. The lack of wind made fishing tough.We did manage to catch some fish everyday. I was working 20-30 ft of water.My plan of attack was to bottom bounce until I found them and than start jigging. We did locate one good honey hole that produced 200 fish in two days of fishing.Here's my question. What do you think of Gullrock?Jeff

Hi Jeff,I have been going to Gullrock for around five years and always thought the fishing was good to excellent. The mayflies and weather can really slow down fishing though as we have experienced.Where was your honey hole at?
200 fish in 2 days, sounds like you did very well. What us Erie guys would do for that success once in a lifetime.
